instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..
definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 13 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi,
I got recently this MacBook with no charging issue. 
I've use <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> schematic diagram to check out the board. 
Laptop was liquid damaged around L3500, <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>. I replaced all liquid damaged components and reball <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> because laptop didn't take charge on one c-type port voltage didn't go up to 20V after it laptop still did not take charge on this port stays on 5v only. I decided to replace <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> after replacement issue persist plus laptop is charging intermittent on other ports.. 
I am not to familiar with those boards I checked under microscope board all looks good, I've removed this ic and issue persist voltage from charger stays on 5v on rest of ports . 

Thanks for advice

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 13 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
SMC requires to talk with ALL <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips from the board; even the ones from not powered USB-C ports.
You cannot test the board removing any of <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip.

This board will not login to macOS without battery; fan goes to max also, in this case.
Use correct schematic to diagnose the board...
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zREKFQB4cY3HldoD84hOILRr-be_UuAY/view?usp=sharing[/URL]
